alert.note: Alert for Churchill; Lyon; Mineral; Storey; Washoe (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 10 at 3:59PM PST until January 10 at 5:30PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM PST FOR SOUTHERN CHURCHILL...NORTH CENTRAL MINERAL...STOREY...SOUTHERN WASHOE AND NORTHERN LYON COUNTIES... At 357 PM PST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Reno-Tahoe Industrial Center to near Austin, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Flash freeze on roads. Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. Interstate 80 from Patrick to Trinity Junction, USA Parkway, Alt-50, US-50 from Silver Springs to New Pass Summit, Alt US-95 from Fernley to Fort Churchill State Park, and US-95 from Fallon to the Lyon- Churchill County line. Locations impacted include... Fallon, Lahontan Reservoir, Fernley, Dayton, Wabuska, Hazen, Middlegate, Stillwater, Silver Springs, Derby Dam, Fort Churchill Station, Stagecoach, Rawhide, Frenchman, Fairview Peak, and US 95 At Lyon-Churchill Co Line. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Wet roadways will quickly freeze and remain hazardous after the snow decreases in intensity. Slow Down and turn on headlights! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED SNOW SQUALL IMPACT...SIGNIFICANT
